com.panayotis.gnuplot.plot
Interface Plot

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPlot, DataSetLinePlot, DataSetPlot, FunctionPlot
public interface Plot

This interface is used by JavaPlot to handle various plot arguments. It can be implemented to provide other entries for the plot command

Method Summary
 void retrieveData(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer)
          Retrieve the data set of this plot command.
 void retrieveDefinition(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer)
          Retrieve the definition part of the plot command.
 

Method Detail

retrieveDefinition

void retrieveDefinition(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer)
Retrieve the definition part of the plot command. This is the part that is given to the plot command, separated by commas. Commas and newlines are automatically added

Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to store the argument of the plot command

retrieveData

void retrieveData(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer)
Retrieve the data set of this plot command. It is used only in data-set plots and it is usually a set of numbers separated by space and newline and terminated by the 'e' character. These data are appended at the end of the actual plot command. If a plot argument does not require additional data sets, then this method should do nothing.

Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to store the data set
